channel.title: JS is it possible?
channel.description: is it possible to retrive a variable from a different site without the restriction to remote things? I want to get like a server status variable off of the forums, yet because the forum is cgi based so for some reason i can't display it in a frame because even though i get the address in the src it loads the page on top of the whole frameset, i just want the corner, so is it possible to get a variable out of something else using JS on a different site? please reword this if you don't understand.

item.title: JS is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @Drunkenoldma Drunkenoldma
item.description:
@Drunkenoldma wrote:

I don’t think that is possible…

Read full topic

item.title: JS is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

i want to display it on a site but when it loads into the frame it then loads again and goes to the main frame, because cgi is runtime instead of html so it doesn’t always stay in the same frame, now can some1 answer my question? to which can actualy happen, i want to retrive variable sStatus from a totaly different website, so how would i load the variable in the first place? and then how from a different server

Read full topic

It would be easier to just use php/cgi yourself to check the server’s status

item.title: JS is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Which server status page would you like to view in your webpage? Anyway, I’m not quite sure what you mean by variable…you can obtain the html source of a webpage with javascript and extract the data you want from it, if that’s what you mean.

Read full topic
